item.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and agree to the resolution, as amended Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: (2/3 required): 415 - 0 (Roll no. 704). (text: CR 9/14/2009 H9455)
Passed/agreed to in House: On motion to suspend the rules and agree to the resolution, as amended Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: (2/3 required): 415 - 0 (Roll no. 704).(text: CR 9/14/2009 H9455)
Considered as unfinished business. (consideration: CR H9569-9570)

At the conclusion of debate, the Yeas and Nays were demanded and ordered. Pursuant to the provisions of clause 8, rule XX, the Chair announced that further proceedings on the motion would be postponed.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H. Res. 260.
Considered under suspension of the rules. (consideration: CR H9455-9457)
Mr. Cohen moved to suspend the rules and agree to the resolution, as amended.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Health.
Referred to the House Committee on Energy and Commerce.

item.fullName: Resident Commissioner Pierluisi, Pedro R. [D-PR-At Large]
Del. Sablan, Gregorio Kilili Camacho [D-MP-At Large]

summary.text: Expresses support for efforts to: (1) lower the rate of infant mortality in the United States; and (2) correct the racial disparities in prenatal care to lower that rate.
Expresses support for efforts to understand racial disparities and the rate of infant mortality in order to lower the infant mortality rate in the United States.

bill.title: Supporting efforts to reduce infant mortality in the United States.

item.title: Supporting efforts to reduce infant mortality in the United States.
Supporting efforts to reduce infant mortality in the United States.

latestAction.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
